definition: see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
Commentary on Shuowen Jiezi (1815) by Duan Yucai 段玉裁[Duan4 Yu4 cai2]

sentences.english: Wang Fuzhi s Shuo Wen Guang Yi focuses on changes of morphology and semantic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 王夫之《說文廣義》着眼詞的形義變化。

sentences.english: The concrete volume also take Shuowen as the basis.
sentences.chinese: 具體分卷也以《說文》爲依據。

sentences.english: Characters of "Sun" Part in"Shuowen" contain the rich cultural information. of ancient society.
sentences.chinese: 《說文》“日”部字蘊含着豐富的上古社會文化信息。

sentences.english: " According to "Shuo Wen" shape and specific description of the heart means the heart no doubt.
sentences.chinese: 據《說文》字形及其具體描述，心指心臟無疑。

sentences.english: Fourth, explaining the principle about Liushu and shuowen.
sentences.chinese: 第四，系統地闡發六書與《說文》的條例。

definition: Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
Classic of Rites
"Erya" or "The Ready Guide", first extant Chinese dictionary, c. 3rd century BC, with glossaries on classical texts
Zuo Zhuan or Tsochuan, Mr Zuo's Annals or Mr Zuo's commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history c. 400 BC attributed to famous blind historian Zuo Qiuming 左丘明[Zuo3 Qiu1 ming2]
original meaning/literal sense
ideogram plus phonetic (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/also known as phonogram, phonetic compound or picto-phonetic character
Zheng Xuan (127-200), late Han scholar
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
"Shiming", late Han dictionary, containing 1502 entries, using puns on the pronunciation of headwords to explain their meaning
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
History of Zhou of the Northern Dynasties, twelfth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Linghu Defen 令狐德棻[Ling2 hu2 De2 fen1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 50 scrolls
sound and meaning
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
